1: Woe to the city guilty of bloodshed![a] She is full of lies;[b] she is filled with plunder;[c] she has hoarded her spoil![d]
2: The chariot drivers will crack their whips;[e] the chariot wheels will shake the ground.[f] The chariot horses[g] will gallop;[h] the war chariots[i] will bolt forward![j]
3: The charioteers[k] will charge ahead;[l] their swords[m] will flash[n] and their spears[o] will glimmer![p] There will be many people slain;[q] there will be piles of the dead and countless casualties[r]— so many that people[s] will stumble over the corpses.
4: Because[t] you have acted like a wanton prostitute[u]— a seductive mistress who practices sorcery,[v] who[w] enslaves[x] nations by her harlotry,[y] and entices peoples by her sorcery[z]—
5: “I am against you,” declares the Lord of Heaven's Armies.[aa] “I will strip off your clothes![ab] I will show your nakedness to the nations and your shame to the kingdoms.
6: I will pelt you with filth;[ac] I will treat you with contempt; I will make you a public spectacle.
7: Everyone who sees you will turn away from you in disgust; they will say, 'Nineveh has been devastated! Who will lament for her?' There will be no one to comfort you!”[ad]
8: You are no more secure[ae] than Thebes[af]— she was located on the banks of the Nile; the waters surrounded her— her[ag] rampart[ah] was the sea, the water[ai] was her wall.
9: Cush[aj] and Egypt had limitless strength;[ak] Put and the Libyans[al] were among[am] her[an] allies.[ao]
10: Yet she went into captivity as an exile;[ap] even her infants were smashed to pieces[aq] at the head of every street. They cast lots[ar] for her nobility;[as] all her dignitaries were bound with chains.
11: You too will act like drunkards;[at] you will go into hiding;[au] you too will seek refuge from the enemy.
12: All your fortifications will be like fig trees[av] with first-ripe fruit:[aw] If they are shaken,[ax] their figs[ay] will fall[az] into the mouth of the eater.[ba]
13: Your warriors will be like women in your midst; the gates of your land will be wide open[bb] to your enemies; fire will consume[bc] the bars of your gates.[bd]
14: Draw yourselves water for a siege![be] Strengthen your fortifications! Trample the mud[bf] and tread the clay! Make mud bricks to strengthen your walls![bg]
15: There the fire will consume[bh] you; the sword will cut you down; it will devour[bi] you like the young locust would. Multiply yourself[bj] like the young locust; multiply yourself like the flying locust!
16: Increase[bk] your merchants more than the stars of heaven! They are like[bl] the young locust that sheds its skin[bm] and flies away.
17: Your courtiers[bn] are like locusts, your officials[bo] are like a swarm of locusts! They encamp in the walls on a cold day, yet when the sun rises, they[bp] fly away,[bq] and no one knows where they[br] are.[bs]
18: Your shepherds[bt] are sleeping, O king of Assyria. Your officers[bu] are slumbering![bv] Your people are scattered like sheep[bw] on the mountains, and there is no one to regather them.
19: Your destruction is like an incurable wound;[bx] your demise is like a fatal injury.[by] All who hear what has happened to you[bz] will clap their hands for joy,[ca] for no one ever escaped your endless cruelty![cb]
